blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: all controversy about "t h e  b e d r o o m" aside, does anyone else wanna know more about the murders in that apartment? phil...
question: all controversy about "t h e  b e d r o o m" aside, does anyone else wanna know more about the murders in that apartment? phil said it's a long story. my guess is it's not enough to warrant its own vid, but it could at least be a fun topic to chat about in the next livestream.
answer:
Hey, anon? I know it’s the spooky season and we’re all feeling festive, but I’m not sure I would call multiple murders in the same room a “fun topic”.


Interesting, fascinating, morbidly curious, lots of words. Fun isn’t one I would use here.

reblog.comment:
Hey, anon? I know it’s the spooky season and we’re all feeling festive, but I’m not sure I would call multiple murders in the same room a “fun topic”.


Interesting, fascinating, morbidly curious, lots of words. Fun isn’t one I would use here.

trail.content_raw:
Hey, anon? I know it’s the spooky season and we’re all feeling festive, but I’m not sure I would call multiple murders in the same room a “fun topic”.


Interesting, fascinating, morbidly curious, lots of words. Fun isn’t one I would use here.
trail.content:
Hey, anon? I know it’s the spooky season and we’re all feeling festive, but I’m not sure I would call multiple murders in the same room a “fun topic”.


Interesting, fascinating, morbidly curious, lots of words. Fun isn’t one I would use here.

summary: seeing all the stuff about my “the bedroom” comment, i’d just like to clarify that i did not mean it in an “OMG PHAN PROOOF” way...
question: seeing all the stuff about my “the bedroom” comment, i’d just like to clarify that i did not mean it in an “OMG PHAN PROOOF” way i was pointing out how they seem to be more open now, i know it probably sounded like i was implying something else .
answer:
I actually find that pretty interesting, what you just said. Because how does “the bedroom” make them sound more open? That’s a very normal thing to say, especially when you’re talking about renting an apartment, or talking about something that happened in that particular room, such as three murders.


I guess I’m just failing to see what it is about saying “the” That is more “open” than phrasing it any other way?

reblog.comment:
I actually find that pretty interesting, what you just said. Because how does “the bedroom” make them sound more open? That’s a very normal thing to say, especially when you’re talking about renting an apartment, or talking about something that happened in that particular room, such as three murders.


I guess I’m just failing to see what it is about saying “the” That is more “open” than phrasing it any other way?

trail.content_raw:
I actually find that pretty interesting, what you just said. Because how does “the bedroom” make them sound more open? That’s a very normal thing to say, especially when you’re talking about renting an apartment, or talking about something that happened in that particular room, such as three murders.


I guess I’m just failing to see what it is about saying “the” That is more “open” than phrasing it any other way?
trail.content:
I actually find that pretty interesting, what you just said. Because how does “the bedroom” make them sound more open? That’s a very normal thing to say, especially when you’re talking about renting an apartment, or talking about something that happened in that particular room, such as three murders.


I guess I’m just failing to see what it is about saying “the” That is more “open” than phrasing it any other way?

summary: for some reason i was living for their little voice bits in this vid. especially phil's "uh, no thank you" when talking about...
question: for some reason i was living for their little voice bits in this vid. especially phil's "uh, no thank you" when talking about not renting the murder apartment and dan's "i need you to sHuT uP" at the end. it's obviously not the only video where they've done funny voices, but i just thought they were especially cute and on point in this one.
answer: I guess stress and terror makes everyone’s inner goofball come out.

reblog.comment: I guess stress and terror makes everyone’s inner goofball come out.

trail.content_raw: I guess stress and terror makes everyone’s inner goofball come out.
trail.content: I guess stress and terror makes everyone’s inner goofball come out.
